newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan says rate cut will pump T$25B into economy.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan says rate cut will pump T$25B into economy.

text.p: Taiwan central bank governor Sheu Yuan-dong said on Friday that new reductions in banks' reserve requirements would pump an additional T$25 billion into the island's sluggish economy.
"By releasing the funds, the liquidity in the banking system will be loosened. That will lower costs for banks," Sheu said.
However, Sheu cautioned that banks could not be forced to lower their rates.
"We will not intervene in their decisions," he said.
Sheu announced that reserve requirements would be cut by up to 0.5 percentage points, effective from Saturday.
He made the announcement moments after officials said that Taiwan's gross domestic product growth in the second quarter was just 5.42 percent, well below a May forecast of 6.05 percent.
